reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This very friendly couple has made a small-to-middle-sized hotel into something very unique. The rooms are wonderfully done (modern but quaint at the same time! DETAILS!!), extremely clean, the showers hot, all of that and more... Loved it, and not just because it is in Saint Amour – which is tiny and cute, but not where one would want to stay forever. Take a walk through the wine, look at/buy very nice pottery, or just read a book... Relaxing? Oh yeah! Stay by yourself or chat with the owners, they let you decide.
reviews.title: Paradise Indeed!

reviews.text: The rooms are named after spices – soft hearts with the names stitched on hang from the keys. The garden in the back is wonderful, especially at night with all the candles on. Have a glass of wine and relax – the cook/owner will come by with little "appetizers": mouthwatering! Exotic and tasty spices are combined with delicacies (we had avocado with some lemony asia taste (no, not lemongrass), some kind of fish with, I think, cardamon, and melon sprinkled with Malasian pepper and Fleur de Sel:-)))))). If only the restaurant had been open: currently closed on Mo/Tu... Breakfast was the best I have ever had in France: Homemade joghurt with vanilla, fruit, homemade jams with spices, very good bread (hey, it is France, love that baguette!)...
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Saint-Amour is located in Beaujolais, not Burgundy. The Auberge du Paradis is a lovely, friendly and well-located country inn in the heart of the Beaujolais region. The owners, Cyril & Valérie Laugiere are omnipresent … from taking orders for breakfast to cooking and service dinner in the dining room.
reviews.title: Charming Auberge du Paradis

reviews.text: We had a small problem upon our arrival in spite of having a confirmed reservation for over four month. However, it was quickly resolved and we were installed in «Paprika». It is a charming, well appointed and comfortable room. There is adequate seating, a nice writing desk, plenty of light and a television that gets most (not all channels). The room has a large bath tub, two well-lighted sinks and a separate, ample shower. There is a charming dressing table with mirror and the usual hotel shampoos, etc. The room has a large closet and a safe. The WC is in a separate room.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype

reviews.text: Breakfast is served either in a sunny room or on the adjoining terrace. It was raining and windy during our stay, so we ate in the breakfast room. Cyril took our breakfast order each day of our three day stay. Each day, there was a different «gateau» and a selection of unique preserves laced with exotic spices. I ordered a fried egg one morning; it arrived in a heart shape.
reviews.title: Paradis Found

reviews.text: Saint-Amour is one of the ten «appellations» of Beaujolais. The others are: Juliènas, Chenas, Moulin-à-Vent, Fleurie, Chiroubles, Morgon, Régnié, Brouilly, and Côte de Brouilly. Don’t miss the opportunity to visit these small villages. Stop to taste the Régnié, it is unique. You also are near Macon with such well known wines as Puilly-Fuissé. Don’t miss Georges Duboeuf’s «Le Hameau du Vin» in nearby Romaneche-Thorins. It includes a wine museum, a train museum, beautiful gardens and a working winery.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant of Le Auberge du Paradis is another story. Cyril trained with several well know French chefs, and then cooked in Turkey for three years. There, he acquired a taste for exotic spices. Dinner in the hotel is a fixed menu, i.e., no choice. The service was excruciatingly slow. Some of the mixtures of exotic spices worked; some did not. Our dessert was served after midnight; we started at 8:30 PM!
